headline.main: MAKNASSY PERILED; American Columns Push on Town Near Coast From North, West GERMANS POUNDED AT FAID Foe Still Holds Pass Against Counter-Blow -- Major Enemy Offensive Is Hinted ACTIVITY INCREASES ON THE NORTH AFRICAN FRONT MAKNASSY PERILED BY TWIN U.S. DRIVES

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, Feb. 1 -- American tanks and infantry battered at the strong German positions in Faid Pass yesterday while another American column struck along the road from Sidi bou Zid to Maknassy, farther south in Central Tunisia, and a light armored formation raced around the enemy posts in an attempt to cut off the German forces at Sened, nineteen miles southwest of Maknassy.
abstract: US tanks and infantry batter Ger positions, Faid Pass; Maknassy reptd periled; Gers try to protect vulnerable Sousse-Sfax area; Gers check US force, Sened area; Brit guns prove match for Ger Mark VI tanks; heavy Allied aerial activity, Bizerte; Brit 8th Army takes Zuara; Messina and Tunis points bombed

byline.original: By DREW MIDDLETONWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
